groups.name: variables
groups.visibleRule: command = init || command = validate || command = plan || command = apply || command = destroy || command = refresh || command = import || command = forceunlock || command = show

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The terraform command to run.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Configuration Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Terraform configuration directory. If empty, the root of the repository (build) or artifacts (release) is used, which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: environmentServiceName
inputs.label: Environment Azure Subscription (select if not configured inside terraform code)
inputs.visibleRule: command = plan || command = apply || command = destroy || command = refresh || command = import
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure service connection if you would like the azurerm provider configured for you (using the service principal credentials configured in the selected service connection). **This field is optional.** Leave empty should you choose to self-configure the provider(s) used. Provider environment variables can be configured securely by selecting an env file from the `Secured Variables File` pick list.

inputs.name: runAzLogin
inputs.label: Run Azure CLI Login
inputs.visibleRule: command = plan || command = apply || command = destroy || command = refresh || command = import
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, task will execute az login to enable local-exec provisioner to run az cli commands

inputs.name: secureVarsFile
inputs.label: Secured Variables File (Secrets)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pick a secure file from Azure DevOps Secure Files. This option is used to pass terraform variables using a tfvars or .env file stored in secure files.

inputs.name: workspaceSubCommand
inputs.label: Workspace Sub Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The workspace sub-command to run.

inputs.name: commandOptions
inputs.label: Command Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Any additional options for the selected command such as `-input=true`. Multiple options can be provided delimited by spaces as `-option1=value -option2=value -option3=value`

inputs.name: backendType
inputs.label: Backend Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the terraform backend type to use. Select self-configured if your backend configuration is expected to be set via environment variables or command options. Environment files can be provided using Secure Files Library in AzDO and specified in Secure Files configuration field. Command options such as `-backend-config=` flag can be provided in the Command Options configuration field.

inputs.name: backendServiceArm
inputs.label: Backend Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure resource manager subscription for the terraform backend configuration

inputs.name: ensureBackend
inputs.label: Create Backend (If not exists)
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, a backend will be created according to the configuration provided for the selected backend if it does not exist

inputs.name: backendAzureRmResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource Group Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The resource group which contains the storage account.

inputs.name: backendAzureRmResourceGroupLocation
inputs.label: Resource Group Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the location into which the resource group will be provisioned (i.e. 'eastus')

inputs.name: backendAzureRmStorageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the storage account.

inputs.name: backendAzureRmStorageAccountSku
inputs.label: Storage Account SKU
inputs.helpMarkDown: The storage account SKU. Defaults to Standard_RAGRS.

inputs.name: backendAzureRmContainerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the container to use within the storage account.

inputs.name: backendAzureRmKey
inputs.label: Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The key where to place/look for state file inside the container

inputs.name: allowTelemetryCollection
inputs.label: Allow Telemetry Collection
inputs.helpMarkDown: When checked, allows the collection of usage telemetry to assist with improving the experience.

inputs.name: inputTargetPlanOrStateFilePath
inputs.label: Target Plan or State File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: path to a terraform plan or state file to show its content, If no path is specified, the current state will be shown.

inputs.name: resourceAddress
inputs.label: Resource Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: Terraform [Resource Address](https://www.terraform.io/docs/internals/resource-addressing.html) to which the target resource will be imported. See [terraform import usage](https://www.terraform.io/docs/commands/import.html#usage)

inputs.name: resourceId
inputs.label: Resource ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: ID of the target resource to import. For example, the ID of Azure Resource Group is the /sub/{subId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}. See [azure resource group import example](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/azurerm/r/resource_group.html#import) and [terraform import usage](https://www.terraform.io/docs/commands/import.html#usage)

inputs.name: lockID
inputs.label: Lock ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Lock ID which needs to be forcefully removed

inputs.name: publishPlanResults
inputs.label: Publish Plan Results Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name to give the published plan. If provided, the plan will be published and made available on the Terraform Plan view/tab.

inputs.name: workspaceName
inputs.label: Workspace Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the target workspace

inputs.name: outputName
inputs.label: The name of the output variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: If terraform output shall only provide a single variable provide the name here.

inputs.name: outputType
inputs.label: The type of output [json|raw]
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether terraform output is suppose to be output as json or raw format.
